description: Described as “the sculptor of gesture,” George Minne explored the imagery of kneeling youths throughout his career. The posture of this thin young man suggests physical and psychological self-enclosure, but it is unclear whether the composition embodies torment, grief, resignation, or even languor. This uncertainty enhances the work’s mystery and reflects the artist’s interest in Symbolism, a movement that prized indeterminate, personal meaning.
title: Kneeling Youth
